TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit DataContractResolver extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Provides a mechanism for dynamically mapping types to and from representations during serialization and deserialization.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Developers should be careful about what data is being sent over the wire. You can use transport or message security to secure that data. For more information, see [Security](~/docs/framework/wcf/samples/security-in-wcf.md).
> [!WARNING] > Only use <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.DataContractResolver> if you are completely sure of what information is being serialized. Malicious types can cause unexpected behavior.
## Examples The following example shows how to derive a class from <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.DataContractResolver>. For a working sample, see [DataContractResolver](~/docs/framework/wcf/samples/datacontractresolver.md).
[!code-csharp[DataContractResolver#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/datacontractresolver/cs/datacontractresolver.cs#2)]

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract Type ResolveName (string typeName, string typeNamespace, Type declaredType, System.Runtime.Serialization.DataContractResolver knownTypeResolver);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Type ResolveName(string typeName, string typeNamespace, class System.Type declaredType, class System.Runtime.Serialization.DataContractResolver knownTypeResolver) cil managed
Public MustOverride Function ResolveName (typeName As String, typeNamespace As String, declaredType As Type, knownTypeResolver As DataContractResolver) As Type
public: abstract Type ^ ResolveName(System::String ^ typeName, System::String ^ typeNamespace, Type ^ declaredType, System::Runtime::Serialization::DataContractResolver ^ knownTypeResolver);
abstract member ResolveName : string * string * Type * System.Runtime.Serialization.DataContractResolver -> Type

Docs.param: The type declared in the data contract.
Docs.summary: Override this method to map the specified name and namespace to a data contract type during deserialization.
Docs.returns: The type the name and namespace is mapped to.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If you want to use the known type resolution logic inside your implementation, a reference to it is passed in as the `knownTypeResolver` parameter.
## Examples The following example shows an implementation of the <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.DataContractResolver.ResolveName%2A> method.

public: abstract bool TryResolveType(Type ^ type, Type ^ declaredType, System::Runtime::Serialization::DataContractResolver ^ knownTypeResolver, [Runtime::InteropServices::Out] System::Xml::XmlDictionaryString ^ % typeName, [Runtime::InteropServices::Out] System::Xml::XmlDictionaryString ^ % typeNamespace);

Docs.param: The type declared in the data contract.
Docs.summary: Override this method to map a data contract type to an name and namespace during serialization.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If you want to use the known type resolution logic inside your implementation, a reference to it is passed in as the `knownTypeResolver` parameter.
